hero.title: Trump Accounts, Explained in Plain English
hero.description: Your child may qualify for a $1,000 federal investment account. We translate IRS jargon into simple answers for exhausted parents, confused employers, and overwhelmed tax preparers.
qualify.title: Who Qualifies for a Trump Account?
qualify.subtitle: There are only three requirements — and no income limit.
qualify.citizenDesc: The child must be a United States citizen
qualify.ssnDesc: Must have a Social Security Number
qualify.under18Desc: Must be under 18 at end of election year
qualify.pilotInfo: $1,000 federal pilot deposit: Only children born January 1, 2025 – December 31, 2028 receive the free $1,000. Children born outside this window can still open a Trump Account — they just won't get the deposit. There are no income restrictions — a family earning $30K and a family earning $3M both qualify equally.
calcs.title: Try Our Free Calculators
calcs.subtitle: All tools run in your browser. We don't collect or store any personal data.
share.title: Share With Family & Employers
share.subtitle: Tools designed to help you spread the word about Trump Accounts.
share.wealthReportDesc: Create a personalized "Wealth Map" for your child showing projected balances at 18, 30, and 65. Download and share.
share.giftCardDesc: Ask grandparents to invest in your child's future instead of buying another toy. Shareable digital card generator.
share.hrEmailDesc: Generate a professional email to ask your employer about offering $2,500/yr Trump Account matching.

hubs.whatAreDesc: The complete guide to IRC §530A — eligibility, contributions, investments, and what happens at age 18.
hubs.howToOpen: How to Open a Trump Account
hubs.howToOpenDesc: Step-by-step guide to IRS Form 4547, the trumpaccounts.gov portal, and filing with your 2025 tax return.
hubs.irsNoticeDesc: We translate the IRS's guidance document into language a tired parent can understand at 11pm.
hubs.compare: Trump Account vs 529 vs Roth IRA
hubs.compareDesc: Side-by-side comparison of every children's savings option. Limits, tax treatment, flexibility.
hubs.employersDesc: How to set up a Trump Account contribution program. $2,500/yr per employee, tax-free.
hubs.faqDesc: Eligibility, taxes, divorce, disability, FAFSA, market crashes, and every edge case.
translation.title: The Translation Layer
translation.subtitle: We read the IRS documents so you don't have to.
translation.plainEnglishText: It's an investment account opened for your kid. The money belongs to them. It's held by a financial institution (like Fidelity or Vanguard) and invested in S&P 500 index funds until they turn 18.
faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.a1: Trump Accounts are tax-advantaged investment accounts created by the One Big Beautiful Bill Act under IRC §530A. Every eligible U.S. citizen child born between 2025–2028 can receive a $1,000 federal pilot deposit. The money is invested in S&P 500 index funds during the "growth phase" (birth to 18), then converts to a traditional IRA. Parents and employers can contribute up to $5,000/year.
faq.q2: How do I open a Trump Account for my child?
faq.a2: File IRS Form 4547 with your 2025 tax return (due April 15, 2026). You can also use the trumpaccounts.gov portal starting mid-2026, or mail the form. You'll need your child's Social Security number. The IRS will send activation info starting May 2026.
faq.q3: Who qualifies for the $1,000 federal deposit?
faq.a3: U.S. citizen children born between January 1, 2025 and December 31, 2028 who have a valid Social Security number. There are no income restrictions — every qualifying child gets the same $1,000. Children older than this can still open a Trump Account but won't receive the pilot deposit.
faq.q4: Is this different from a 529 plan?
faq.a4: Yes. A 529 is for education expenses with tax-free withdrawals. A Trump Account converts to a traditional IRA at 18 — the money can be used for anything. Different tax treatment, different limits, different investment options. Most families should use both.
